page.title: 09Thornhill Farms.
page.content: The most common crops on local farms are barley, wheat and oats. In this area the main livestock are sheep and cattle.The types of food which come from these animals are milk, butter, cheese, cream, yoghurt and meat. The most used machinery around the farm are tractors, trailors, combines and landrovers. The tractor's tyres last a very long time as they are usually going over fields or mud tracks. Drumcork is the biggest dairy farm in the area and Hayfield is the biggest sheep farm. Most farmers have employees to help them, also his wife who feeds horses and other animals.
